result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl Andre Nelson

11:33 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Darryl Andre Nelson appeared by video.  Attorney Angela Raye Olson appeared by video for Darryl Andre Nelson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file and notes parties were approved to appear by zoom if no pleas today.  Atty Olson states this is on trial track but needs time to hear back from crime lab regarding results. ADA Becker to continue to follow up with lab to see when results will be available. If next hearing is for scheduling only Atty Olson and DE can appear by zoom but needs to be requested ahead of time. DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 11:38 AM. bph

Pre-signed wavier of extradition. Signed by DE. arc
Preliminary hearing on March 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- No possession of firearms.

- Defendant to sign pre- signed waiver of extradition.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. Defendant must report to Justice Support Center 1 time per week for address verification. I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  D.F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
